articles.title: U.S. puts troops on alert amid fears of Russia-Ukraine conflict. Europe watches on - CNBC
articles.description: The U.S. Department of Defense has said that about 8,500 American troops are awaiting orders to deploy to the region if Russia does invade Ukraine.
articles.content:
U.S. army soldiers stand in formation during a joint military tactical training exercise Blowback 2016 with Bulgaria's army at Novo Selo military ground on April 11, 2016.

articles.title: Sania Mirza bids adieu to Australia Open with quarterfinal loss in mixed doubles - The Indian Express
articles.description: Sania Mirza, partnering American Rajeev Ram, lost the match 4-6, 6-7 to wildcard entries Fourlis and Kubler in one hour 30 minutes.
articles.content: Trailblazing India tennis star Sania Mirza’s swansong appearance at the Australian Open ended with a quarterfinal loss to local pair Jaimee Fourlis and Jason Kubler in the mixed doubled event on Tues… [+1243 chars]

articles.title: Lower risk of vaccine-breakthrough infections for mRNA-1273 recipients - News-Medical.Net
articles.description: Recently, a team of researchers examined breakthrough infections, hospitalizations, and mortality rates in double-dose messenger RNA (mRNA) vaccine recipients in a research letter published in the Journal of American Medical Association (JAMA).

articles.title: Do I really need to get a COVID-19 booster? CDC real-world study confirms effectiveness - Austin American-Statesman
articles.description: A U.S. study finds waning effectiveness of initial series of COVID vaccines, plus difference in delta and omicron variants reactions to the shots.
articles.content:
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention released a study Friday that provided real-world U.S. numbers about the effectiveness of boosters for both the delta and omicron variants of COVID-19.
